1: Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger. Do not discipline me in your raging fury.[c]
2: Have mercy on me,[d] Lord, for I am frail. Heal me, Lord, for my bones are shaking.[e]
3: I am absolutely terrified,[f] and you, Lord—how long will this continue?[g]
4: Relent, Lord, rescue me![h] Deliver me because of your faithfulness.[i]
5: For no one remembers you in the realm of death.[j] In Sheol who gives you thanks?[k]
6: I am exhausted as I groan. All night long I drench my bed in tears;[l] my tears saturate the cushion beneath me.[m]
7: My eyes[n] grow dim[o] from suffering; they grow weak[p] because of all my enemies.[q]
8: Turn back from me, all you who behave wickedly,[r] for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.[s]
9: The Lord has heard my appeal for mercy; the Lord has accepted[t] my prayer.
10: They will be humiliated[u] and absolutely terrified.[v] All my enemies will turn back and be suddenly humiliated.
